Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which the Obama administration has been outsourcing by sending money to solar and wind energy companies that make their products outside the United States.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the Obama administration has been outsourcing in the manner described.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that sending money to solar and wind energy companies that make their products outside the United States equates to outsourcing American jobs, without considering other factors or alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why money may be sent to solar and wind energy companies that make their products outside the United States, such as the availability of certain components or the global nature of the industry.
